abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as unsatisfactory. The key lessons learned are: 1)
            Quality at entry is essential to ensure the successful
            preparation and implementation of a complex multi-state
            project. 2) The early formation of an exclusive, empowered
            project implementation unit with strong implementation
            capabilities is important to ensure higher quality at entry
            and effective project implementation. 3) The preparation and
            implementation of a multi-state project have proven to be
            ineffective due to a reduced sense of ownership by the
            participating states and inadequate supervision resources
            provided by the Bank. 4) Adequate maintenance funding
            together with improved maintenance planning is essential to
            ensure the sustainability of project outcomes. 5) Without
            appropriate arrangements for the operation and maintenance
            of equipment and machinery procured under the project, the
            sustainability of this component will probably be
            unsatisfactory. 6) The pre-qualification of financially and
            technically weak contractors had a negative effect in the
            implementation of the civil works component of the project.
            7) The primary focus of the project was on the physical
            improvement of the core state road network, and not enough
            emphasis was placed on the project design, which were
            intended to support the stated development of the
            institutional improvement to the implementing agencies.
